japanese:
上杉さん……。
これは一体、何事なのでしょうか？
translation: Uesugi-san... What on earth is happening here?

japanese:
さっきまで海沿いの公園にいたのに、
いまは見知らぬ村の中を歩いている――
translation:
Just a moment ago we were at the park by the sea,
and now we're walking through an unfamiliar village%p-2;――

japanese: なにかの怪奇現象に巻き込まれたのでは！？
translation: ARE WE IN SOME ALTERNATE UNIVERSE?!

japanese: 小芝居はその辺でいいぞ。
translation: Enough with the jokes.

japanese:
えー！
少しは合わせてくれてもいいじゃないですか！
translation:
Wha-?!
Can't you just play along for a bit?!

japanese: 五月、後は頼む。
translation: Itsuki, you take over.

japanese: ええっ！？
translation: Huhhh?!

japanese:
ど、どうしましょー？
ここはいつ時代のどこなんでしょうかー？
translation:
Wh-what shall we dooo?
I wonder what era we're innn?

japanese: ……マジでやるとは思わなかった。
translation: ...I didn't think you'd actually go through with it.

japanese: 振っておいてなんですかその言い方は！
translation:
What's with that tone,
after making me do this?!

japanese:
お前らの小芝居は置いておいて。
ここは、琉球王国時代の集落を再現している
エリアだな。
translation:
Enough with the jokes, you two.
This area is modeled after a village
from the Ryukyu Kingdom era.

japanese:
ふむふむ。
そんな施設まであるんですか、ここって。
translation:
Hmm, wow. I didn't know they had a facility like this
here as well.

japanese:
村をまるごと作ってしまうなんて、
スケールが大きいですね。
本当に、知らない村に迷い込んだようです。
translation:
The fact that they built
a village of this scale inside a park is very impressive.
It's almost as we've stumbled upon an unknown village.

japanese:
ここに建っている家って、ザ・沖縄って感じですね。
映画や本で見るような造りをしてます。
translation:
The houses here all look like ZEE Okinawan houses
you would see in movies and books.

japanese: ええ、あの屋根の作りなんて特徴的です。
translation: Yes, the roofing design particularly stands out.

japanese:
（……正確に言えば『ザ』じゃなく『ジ』なんだが。
　まあ、ここで言うことでもないよな。
　つい気になっちまう）
translation:
(...Strictly speaking, the way Yotsuba's pronouncing
 'the' is wrong, but that's not really important
 right now. It's just something that's bugging me.)

japanese:
あれは台風対策だな。
赤瓦の隙間に漆喰（しっくい）を塗って、
風に飛ばされないようにしたんだ。
translation:
Oh, that's a measure to protect against typhoons.
They apply plaster to the gaps in the red roof tiles
to keep them from getting blown away by the wind.

japanese:
沖縄の民家に石垣や塀が多いのも、
台風から家を守るためって話だ。
translation:
It's said that the many stone walls and fences
around Okinawan houses
are also meant to protect against typhoons.

japanese:
なるほど、毎年やってくる台風に立ち向かううちに
こうなっていったんですか。
translation:
I see, so this is the aftermath of facing
the annual typhoons every year.

japanese: 伝統的な街並みには、ちゃんと理由があるのですね。
translation:
There's indeed a reason
behind the traditional townscape.

japanese:
ああ。
沖縄は石灰岩がよく採れたから、
石垣とか石畳が作りやすかったらしいぞ。
translation:
Yeah. Okinawa has abundant limestone deposits,
which made it easy to create stone walls
and stone-paved roads.

japanese:
そういや、首里城の近くに
当時の石畳が残った通りがあるって話だが。
translation:
Come to think of it,
I heard there's a street near Shurijo Castle
that still has the original stone paving from that time.

japanese:
そうなんですか？
気になりますね、ちょっとスマホで検索してみます。
translation:
Is that so? I'm curious.
I'm gonna look it up on my phone real quick.

japanese: ええと……首里城近くで……。
translation: Let's see... Near Shurijo Castle...

japanese:
おお、これですね！
首里金城町（きんじょうちょう）石畳道って
名前だそうです。
translation:
Oh, this is it!
It's apparently called the Kinjo Stone Road.

japanese:
見てください、これもザ・沖縄ですよ！
通りの民家も石垣で、赤い瓦を使ってます。
translation:
Look, the houses along the road have stone walls
and red roof tiles too. This is really 'ZEE Okinawa!'

japanese:
まあ……！
素敵な道ですね。
translation:
Well!
What a gorgeous street.

japanese:
確かに、昔ながらの沖縄って感じだな。
行ってみるか？
translation:
Yes, it really gives off
an old-fashioned Okinawan vibe.
Do you want to go check it out?

japanese:
あ、待ってください。
行った人の感想を見ると――
translation:
Oh, wait a minute. According to people
who have been there%p-2;――

japanese:
結構たくさんの人が、坂がキツくて
登るのが大変って言ってますよ。
translation:
The slopes are very steep
and it's difficult to climb.

japanese: ……上杉さん、大丈夫ですか？
translation: ...Uesugi-san, you gonna be alright?

japanese: いざとなればお前がいる！
translation: I always have you, if things go south!

japanese: もちろんです！　お任せください！
translation: Of course! Leave it to me!

japanese:
たとえ上杉さんが疲れ果てて動けなくなっても、
私が肩車して坂の上までお運びしましょう！
translation:
Even if you're exhausted and can't move, Uesugi-san,
I'll carry you on my shoulders
and take you up the hill!

japanese:
見ろ五月、この四葉の頼もしい言葉と
溢れる笑顔を！
translation:
Itsuki, take notes of these words of encouragement
and overflowing smiles from Yotsuba!

japanese: ……言っていて情けなくならないんですか、あなたは。
translation: ...Aren't you embarrassed saying that?

japanese: ところで、上杉さん。
translation: By the way, Uesugi-san.

japanese: なんだ？
translation: What's up?

japanese:
今日、行き先を変更したのは、
夕べ作戦を思いついたからですよね？
translation:
Did you change our destination today
because you came up with a strategy last night?

japanese: まあ、そういうことだ。
translation: Well, that's the idea.

japanese:
ここが、あなたと三玖の思い出の場所……
とは思えないのですが。
translation:
I can't imagine this...
being a place of memories for you and Miku, though.

japanese:
どういう意味だ？
俺が坂道程度でへばると？
translation:
What do you mean?
Do you think I'm going to be dinged up by a hill?

japanese: 正直に言わせてもらえば、可能性はあるのでは。
translation:
To be honest,
there's a possibility that you might.

japanese:
ま、まあ、なにかあったら私が担いで、
見事に無酸素登頂を達成してみせます！
translation:
W-well, if something happens, I'll carry you
and make it to the summit without oxygen!

japanese: お前はどこの雪山に登るつもりなんだ。
translation: What snowy mountain are you planning on climbing?

japanese:
（しかし、観光するだけなのに
　体力の心配があるのは我ながら情けない。
　少しは改善しないとな……）
translation:
(But it's embarrassing that I have to worry
 about my stamina even though I'm just sightseeing.
 I've gotta improve my fitness...)

japanese: ところで、上杉さん。
translation: By the way, Uesugi-san.

japanese: なんだ？
translation: What's up?

japanese:
今日、行き先を変更したのは、
夕べ作戦を思いついたからですよね？
translation:
Did you change our destination today
because you came up with a strategy last night?

japanese: まあ、そういうことだ。
translation: Well, that's the idea.

japanese:
ここが、あなたと三玖の思い出の場所……
とは思えないのですが。
translation:
I can't imagine this...
being a place of memories for you and Miku, though.

japanese: 三玖が大変かもしれないな。
translation: Miku might have a tough time.

japanese:
（あいつも体力がないんだ。
　一般人でもキツいとなると……）
translation:
(She's got little stamina.
 If it's tough for ordinary folk...)

japanese: ほほーう。
translation: Ho-ho.

japanese: なるほど、そちらの心配ですか。
translation: I see, that's what you're worried about.

japanese: は？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
自分より先に三玖を心配！
さすが彼氏です！
translation:
You're worrying about Miku more than yourself!
That's what a boyfriend should do!

japanese:
なっ！？
いや、これはだな！？
translation: WHA?! No, this is different, you know?!

japanese:
照れなくていいんですよ。
恋人なら当然のことです。
translation:
You don't have to be embarrassed.
It's natural for lovers to worry about each other.

japanese: ええ、このくらいののろけは許容範囲です。
translation: Yes, this level of sweetness is acceptable.

japanese: ところで、上杉さん。
translation: By the way, Uesugi-san.

japanese: なんだ？
translation: What's up?

japanese:
今日、行き先を変更したのは、
夕べ作戦を思いついたからですよね？
translation:
Did you change our destination today
because you came up with a strategy last night?

japanese: まあ、そういうことだ。
translation: Well, that's the idea.

japanese:
ここが、あなたと三玖の思い出の場所……
とは思えないのですが。
translation:
I can't imagine this...
being a place of memories for you and Miku, though.

japanese:
そりゃな。
来たのは今日が初めてだ。
translation: No doubt. Today is our first time coming here.

japanese: じゃあ、どうしてここに？
translation: Then, why here?

japanese:
そう聞きたくなるのはわかるが、
ここなら上手くいくはずなんだ。
translation:
I know you want to ask that,
but I'm sure this is the right time and place.

japanese:
なるほど。
その表情、自信があるのですね。
translation: I see. You seem confident about it.

japanese:
では、これ以上は聞きません。
頑張ってください、上杉君。
translation:
Alright, I won't ask any further.
Good luck, Uesugi-kun.

japanese: おう。
translation: Thanks.
